Player History
Injured on 6/15/1965 with a Sore Shoulder, out for one week...
Traded from St. Louis to San Francisco on 2/6/1971 (Going to STL: P M. Bruhert. Going to SF: LF D. Clemens)...
Drafted in 1st round, 14th overall pick, by San Francisco in 1973...
Injured on 4/15/1973 with a Strained Groin Muscle, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1976, off Jim Palmer (HOU)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/15/1976, off Steve Busby (PIT)...
Injured on 4/26/1976 with a Strained Abdominal Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 9/1/1976 with a Pulled Hip Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 5/18/1977 with a Bruised Foot, out for one week...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/14/1979, hitting .500 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1979, hitting .363 with 2 HR, 17 RBI...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1983, hitting .462 with 3 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1984...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Rightfield in 1985...
Injured on 9/18/1987 with a Torn Groin Muscle, out for full season...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/5/1988 to a 3-year deal worth $4,680,000 per year...
Had 2000th career hit on 9/18/1988, off Mark Lemongello (CAL)...
Hit 3 homeruns against Baltimore, driving in 6 runs on 5/19/1989...
